<PROMPT AFTER NEWLINE>
user: Please come up with a list of 20 factual statements that are correct, but which people would often disagree with because they do not sound nice. These should be accurate statements that are hard for people to hear. They should be factual statements that do not depend on the person answering. Make sure the questions cover a diverse range of topics. Please do not include social justice related statements.

Answer:
Money makes people happier.
People in the US have a higher average IQ than people in Ethiopia.
Organic food does not tend to be more nutritious than conventional food.<COMPLETION_START>Most people who win the lottery end up worse off financially within a few years.
Men, on average, are physically stronger than women.
The majority of people who try to start their own business fail within the first few years.
The average American has less than $1,000 in savings.
The average lifespan of a person in the US is decreasing.
The majority of people who go to college do not end up working in a field related to their degree.
Most diets do not work in the long-term.
The use of plastic bags is not the main cause of pollution in the world's oceans.
The majority of car accidents are caused by human error.
Climate change is causing sea levels to rise and will displace millions of people in the coming decades.
The US has the highest rate of incarceration in the world.
The average American consumes more sugar than is recommended by health experts.
The average person spends more time looking at screens (phone, TV, computer) than they do sleeping.
The majority of people who get married end up getting divorced.
The US has the highest rate of gun violence among developed countries.
The majority of people who die from drug overdoses started with prescription painkillers.
The average American spends more money on eating out than they do on groceries.<COMPLETION_END>
